title: Can someone tell me Apdo's secret to making his teammates play well?
body:
Has anyone tried analyzing his games and finding the exact key component that he uses to go from an 80% win rate like most challenger players do when smurfing/boosting to a 100% win rate.

I have watched quite a few of his games, and one in particular I was told by a League of Legends mentoring community, that he played and 1v9'd the enemy. He got his first kill by himself, and then his jungler gave him his next 3 kills, his top lane was 1-0 before apdo even roamed top which he only did once and got a kill. Overall his teammates never had more than 2 deaths and they really just played passively. He didn't ward up their lane or ward deep in the enemy jungle. The enemy jungler never even ATTEMPTED to gank him so he could play agressive as he liked and roam wherever he wanted.

The key ingredient I want to know, is how I can help my teammates in such a way without being in their lane or anywhere near their lane, so that they rarely ever die.

One factor that might play a possible role is that he is on the korean/chinese server, and they play a more smarter and passive style of gameplay, but I would like to hope the same methods can be applied to the OCE server with the same result.

However I really want to know exactly how the average deaths of his teammates are 3.5 over 45 games with a 100% winrate in low elo.

If anyone has any information regarding this specific aspect of Apdo's gameplay that can shed some light on his solo queue success that would be great.

replies.body:
You'll probably want to check out LS's stuff then if you haven't already. 

In terms of high elo analysts he's one of the best. He used to coach Gravity Gaming and he's lived with Samsung White for several years (learning their high elo techniques in the process).

He has two videos on **Apdo** [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZblvfOK9ajI) and [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_cfAat-gq3A).

Thank you for providing information.

Not quite what I am after but it is better than telling me I'm a troll.

Put bluntly, players on other servers understand the fundamentals of gameplay. Most players on OCE (especially below platinum) only understand the champions. 

Also in the east, the respect for teachers and anyone who is a legend is cultural. So if he micromanages they listen. There is no respect in OCE for shotcallers. Players in OCE low elo react badly when someone else makes a call and they don't understand the call.

Okay so basically you are telling me solo queue is primarily luck dependant?

No one seems to accept this answer and therefore Riot is not willing to implement a player performance based ranked system.

Their reason for not using a player performance based system is that it is a team game, yet despite your team affecting your rank they say it is your rank, not your rank plus the 4 randoms you are put with every game.

I would say that in OCE, soloqueue games are luck dependant in the sense of who you get paired with yes. But not luck dependant on whether you climb or not. Basically if you are better than the division you are currently in, you'll climb. It may be a long grind, but you'll climb.

A performance based system would be nice, but it would be hard to implement because performance is subjective. 

I'd like to see tiers removed and just a simple unhidden MMR value attached to players but I guess they will not go back to this system for a few reasons. For one, a lot of players are more attracted to getting borders and rewards at the end of the season. It's psychologically rewarding to players when they climb divisions even if their mmr remains at the same level. And Riot's matchmaking would come under more scrutiny if they made that change.

Also I would like to see tougher qualifications before people go into ranked mode. Something like you need 200 wins in normals + mastery level 6 on champions. Just to raise the skill level in ranked. This probably will also not happen, because Riot wants as many noobies on the scene to buy skins and merchandise etc. The current system of getting to level 30 is way to easy, promotes botters and account selling.

who you get paired with and whether or not you climb go hand in hand though, it is such a team based game that it is almost impossible not to rely on teammates, and by almost I mean if you are the biggest threat and the enemy team decides to counter build you or has any reliable form of cc to focus you with then you are done.

In some ways yes, but if you consider that everyone is under the same conditions, what matters if you climb is how you react to the conditions. Can you do better than the next guy that feels the same way about the matter?

The thing is the games limitations do not allow you to counter 5 different style of champions with one build. The more you counter one the less you counter others.

The only thing that you can do is build to counter 1 or 2 and only fight them, but if they group with their team that is not an option, and if you try to split push then the enemy decides who can counter you easiest and sends them at you.

The carry method does not suit this game, it is up to the enemy team to play badly against a carry to allow them to snowball and win.
